overview_of_class: This course teaches the essentials of editing content for newspaper and for the Web. Students will learn how to edit for grammar and Associated Press style; achieve accuracy, clarity and objectivity; think critically and exercise news judgment; write headlines and captions for print and online; edit photos and graphics; and design pages for newspapers.
name: Media Presentation: News
title: JOUR JOUR 310-0-20 Media Presentation: News
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Requisite:  Reserved for students who have taken & passed JOUR 301.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course teaches the essentials of editing content for newspaper and for the Web. Students will learn how to edit for grammar and Associated Press style; achieve accuracy, clarity and objectivity; think critically and exercise news judgment; write headlines and captions for print and online; edit photos and graphics; and design pages for newspapers.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Editing Today (although possible change before September);
2010 AP Stylebook;
Watch Your Words by Marda Dunsky;
Webster's 4th edition.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: This class is reserved for pre-JR students assigned to take the course. Any available seats will be released to CAESAR registration after pre-JR students are enrolled.

subject: JOUR
